section.title: FileTreeWalkerFeature
section.para:
The FileTreeWalkerFeature (see
) implements the FileVisitor Interface from the java.nio.* package and therefore it works like one. To make long things short, it goes recursively through the file tree and calls the methods on its observer on each position in the tree:
- It calls updateBeforeDir() before visiting a directory.
- It calls updateFileVisit() when a File is visited.
- It calls updateFileVisitFailed() if the file visitation failed.
- It calls updateAfterDir() if every subdirectory and file were visit in a directory.
- It calls updateComplete() if file tree completely walked.
All observers will be unregistered after a file tree walk is completed.

For more Information how the FileVisitor works see:
Java7 API: FileVisitor
Java7 Tutorial: Walking the File Tree
